image.altText: A man wearing shorts, tshirt and sneakers and a backpack stands on a sandy track with ocean in the background

props.synopsis: Three months after former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs was convicted and fined over drug supply charges, he has detailed his plans to hike the Kokoda Track on a "personal journey of restoration and renewal".

title.children: David Speirs speaks of being led to 'dark and scary places' ahead of Kokoda Track hike

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: A charge has been dropped against neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell over a march through the Adelaide CBD on Australia Day.

title.children: Loitering charge dropped against neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell over Australia Day march

image.altText: A group of young pelicans stand in the water of a lagoon

props.synopsis: After decades of environmental degradation, South Australia's internationally significant Coorong wetlands are now at risk of becoming a "wasteland" due to the state's toxic algal bloom, advocates fear.

title.children: Coorong 'on the brink' amid fears algal bloom could be final straw

image.altText: A small mouse peeps out between a person's fingers.

props.synopsis: Conservationists have offered surprising insights into what small mammal colonies may have looked like before Europeans arrived in Australia.

title.children: 27-year study of outback reserve offers glimpse into pre-colonial times

image.altText: SES volunteers removing water following a flood in a basement.

props.synopsis: A man who was found in his underwear and chewing on an espresso pod after setting off fire hydrants on six levels of a building in Adelaide's CBD, causing millions of dollars of damage, has been jailed for at least 18 months.

title.children: Man who flooded medical research centre by setting off fire hydrants jailed

image.altText: A blue sculpture among pavers and trees.

props.synopsis: A controversial sculpture that sparked complaints about its cost and design arrives in Mount Gambier to a positive reception.

title.children: 'Blue blob' or 'beloved new landmark'? It's got this city talking

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Outback murderer Bradley Murdoch's death could present a fresh opportunity to find the remains of his victim, British backpacker Peter Falconio, according to a leading forensic expert.

title.children: Killer's death presents 'opportunity' to find Falconio's remains

image.altText: Outback flooding in South Australia's far north.

props.synopsis: The South Australian and federal governments purchase a new barge that can transport livestock and tourists from Channel Country communities that could be isolated for eight months.

title.children: Relief for flooded communities as governments refloat $27m barge service

image.altText: Albo and panda

props.synopsis: The prime minister says his high-profile visits to the Great Wall and a giant panda breeding and research centre were about showing "respect" to his host country.

title.children: Albanese rejects Coalition criticism his six-day China visit wasn't 'strictly necessary'

image.altText: SANFL and Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran.

props.synopsis: Australian rules football champion and Hall of Fame legend Barrie Robran is being remembered as "an icon, a mentor, and a true gentleman" following his death at the age of 77.

title.children: Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran dies aged 77

image.altText: A man with a long white beard wearing a beanie sits in front of a window with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Ngarrindjeri Elder Uncle Major 'Moogy' Sumner says he is worried an Indigenous man inside South Australia's high-security prison could become "another death in custody", following claims he has self-harmed multiple times while behind bars. WARNING: This story contains reference to self-harm and suicide.

title.children: Elder warns Indigenous man in high-security prison is in 'dire situation'

image.altText: A pig with a dark background behind it.

props.synopsis: Footage taken by an activist group allegedly in a piggery north of Adelaide shows pigs feeding on carcasses, some belonging to other pigs. WARNING: this story contains graphic content that may distress readers.

title.children: Cannibalism footage sparks animal welfare investigation at SA piggery

image.altText: An Australian border force officer in uniform holds a box of vapes in gold packaging

props.synopsis: Almost half a billon dollars worth of vapes have been taken off the street since new laws came into force 18 months ago as research shows fewer young Australians are taking up vaping.

title.children: More than 10 million vapes seized since 2024 import ban

image.altText: A man in glasses and a suit outside glass doors

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer injured in a shooting which killed Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig in 2023 has recounted the moment he held his dying colleague in his arms. Another officer shared her guilt for unknowingly leading her colleagues into "a nightmare".

title.children: Police officer describes moment he held dying colleague in his arms after ambush

image.altText: A woman with a scarf sitting in an armchair next to a cabinet with vases on top

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman who feared she might not make it while waiting for heart surgery has been told her life-saving procedure has been scheduled for next week.

title.children: Patient fears she will die waiting for pacemaker amid surgery delay

image.altText: A person pointing to a passage in a children's book

props.synopsis: Children who experience domestic violence are often left without a voice. A new storybook written by ten children who have lived experience sheds a light on the profound impact of family violence. Warning: This story contains content that may cause distress for some readers.

title.children: 'Dad is like a tornado': Children capture domestic violence through storytelling

image.altText: A woman holding her daughter in her arms for a selfie photo

props.synopsis: Tech giant Meta bans and then reinstates an Australian woman's Instagram account, wrongly accusing her business page of posting child exploitation material.

title.children: Australians angry as Meta bans accounts with few appeal avenues

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a suit inside state parliament.

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on NSW Parliament to take action against independent MP Mark Latham after media reports alleged he took photos of female colleagues and made disparaging comments about them in private messages, and recorded a sex video in his office.

title.children: 'Not acceptable': Mark Latham's alleged messages from parliament condemned

image.altText: A black and white photo of Gough Whitlam and Mark Latham in university robes

props.synopsis: He once had a chance at the top job in the nation — now Mark Latham is defending himself against allegations of domestic abuse and being involved in a sex tape in his NSW parliamentary office.

title.children: New chapter in story of a man who was once a protégé of Gough Whitlam

image.altText: A close up of a woman with a white dress and pixie cut

props.synopsis: Watson, 35, was banned for driving at 38 miles per hour (61kph) in a 30-mile zone in south-east England.

title.children: Harry Potter actress Emma Watson banned from driving after speeding

image.altText: A person in a hard hat works on a huge metal pipe system inside a concrete tunnel, with a bike to one side.

props.synopsis: Current models of physics dictate there should be as much antimatter in the universe as matter, but there isn't. Work at the world's largest particle collider has come a step closer to explaining why.

title.children: Atom smasher spots new clue to explain why the universe exists

image.altText: Three Indian male police officers in tan clothing speaking with a woman in a floral top and red skirt surrounded by green trees

props.synopsis: Indian authorities claim 40-year-old Nina Kutina had been living in the cave in the country's south for more than a week, and say she told police she was "interested in staying in the forest and worshipping God".

title.children: Russian mum, daughters found living in Indian cave after 'overstaying visa'

image.altText: An orange and black logo reading EFTEX

props.synopsis: The move comes after an ABC investigation revealed major private ATM suppliers were targeting the illegal tobacco industry.

title.children: Payments to ATMs in tobacconists to be cut off after ABC investigation

image.altText: A man in a navy suit walks with a blonde woman and a man wearing black glasses.

props.synopsis: Former ADFA cadet Angus Robertson is sentenced to almost two years in jail for raping a fellow cadet in her academy room, after the victim told him she would go no further than kissing.

title.children: Judge scathing of ADFA in sentencing former cadet for rape of colleague

image.altText: A close-up shot of a newborn baby's hand inside an adult hand.

props.synopsis: Researchers in the United Kingdom have announced the successful birth of eight babies after a clinical trial of an IVF technique known as mitochondrial donation.

title.children: What is mitochondrial donation and why is it called 'three-person IVF'?

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Scott Alexander McDougall became the first convicted murderer in the ACT more than a decade when he was found guilty of murdering two people.

title.children: Victim’s family horrified double-murderer could be released

image.altText: Man holds a tissue to his face to blow his nose.

props.synopsis: The Australian Medical Association fears WA is in the midst of one of the state's worst flu seasons as cases soar and vaccination rates dwindle.

title.children: 'Disaster waiting to happen': AMA sounds alarm on 'horror' WA flu season

image.altText: A man with an Australian flag bandana brandishes a piece of paper

props.synopsis: Southern Cross University provides research funding to a conspiracy theorist who has wrongly claimed fire ant bait causes ADHD, autism, and low fertility in humans.

title.children: Fire ant conspiracy theorist gets uni funding for field work

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The aviation sector has been home to two of the nation's most high-profile murderers, however, documents reveal Airservices Australia and CASA have not reviewed their systems of psychometric testing.

title.children: No aviation psychometric test review after Erin Patterson, Greg Lynn cases

image.altText: Man walking with coffee

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say two complainants, unknown to each other, who gave strikingly similar accounts of alleged assaults by NSW MP Gareth Ward, is evidence they are telling the truth.

title.children: MP Gareth Ward's alleged assaults 'not a coincidence', court hears

image.altText: A smiling Pedro Pascal takes a selfie with fans at a launch event for The Fantastic Four: First Steps.

props.synopsis: The latest Marvel offering is another blockbuster, but the off-screen chemistry of its cast helped them find the sense of family at the movie's heart.

title.children: Marvel's new Fantastic Four are a family on and off the screen

image.altText: Colouring pencils in a plastic container.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old man is alleged to have committed the offence last week at a childcare centre operated by Affinity Education Group.

title.children: Brisbane childcare worker charged with indecent treatment of 4yo

image.altText: Audun Grønvold poses with his medal at the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics.

props.synopsis: Olympic ski cross medallist Audun Grønvold dies, aged 49, after being struck by lightning while on holiday.

title.children: Norwegian Olympic medallist dies after being struck by lightning

image.altText: A woman in a supermarket aisle looking at a generic block of chocolate

props.synopsis: A cocoa shortage means the price of chocolate has gone up. Experts explain why this is happening and how long it's expected to last.

title.children: Why chocolate could get even more expensive
